<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements the formatv() function which can be used with other LLVM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// subsystems to provide printf-like formatting, but with improved safety and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// flexibility.  The result of &#96;formatv&#96; is an object which can be streamed to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a raw&#95;ostream or converted to a std::string or llvm::SmallString.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Tuple&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object/#a974591deeb830e3934264cf6b34fefbe">formatv&#95;object</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object-base/#a5ecf8eb658bde7495b1e140fc67668d4">formatv&#95;object&#95;base</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Storage for the parameter adapters.  Since the base class erases the type</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the parameters, we have to own the storage for the parameters here, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have the base class store type-erased pointers into this tuple.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Tuple Parameters;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::array&lt;support::detail::format&#95;adapter &#42;, std::tuple&#95;size&lt;Tuple&gt;::value&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ParameterPointers;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The parameters are stored in a std::tuple, which does not provide runtime</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// indexing capabilities.  In order to enable runtime indexing, we use this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// structure to put the parameters into a std::array.  Since the parameters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are not all the same type, we use some type-erasure by wrapping the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parameters in a template class that derives from a non-template superclass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Essentially, we are converting a std::tuple&lt;Derived&lt;Ts...&gt;&gt; to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// std::array&lt;Base&#42;&gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">create&#95;adapters &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight">... Ts&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::array&lt;support::detail::format&#95;adapter &#42;, std::tuple&#95;size&lt;Tuple&gt;::value&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">    operator()(Ts &amp;...Items) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;&#123;&amp;Items...&#125;&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Format text given a format string and replacement parameters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ===General Description===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Formats textual output.  &#96;Fmt&#96; is a string consisting of one or more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replacement sequences with the following grammar:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// rep&#95;field ::= &quot;&#123;&quot; &#91;index&#93; &#91;&quot;,&quot; layout&#93; &#91;&quot;:&quot; format&#93; &quot;&#125;&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// index     ::= &lt;non-negative integer&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// layout    ::= &#91;&#91;&#91;char&#93;loc&#93;width&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// format    ::= &lt;any string not containing &quot;&#123;&quot; or &quot;&#125;&quot;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// char      ::= &lt;any character except &quot;&#123;&quot; or &quot;&#125;&quot;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loc       ::= &quot;-&quot; | &quot;=&quot; | &quot;+&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// width     ::= &lt;positive integer&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// index   - An optional non-negative integer specifying the index of the item</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           in the parameter pack to print. Any other value is invalid. If its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           not specified, it will be automatically assigned a value based on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           the order of rep&#95;field seen in the format string. Note that mixing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           automatic and explicit index in the same call is an error and will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           fail validation in assert-enabled builds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// layout  - A string controlling how the field is laid out within the available</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// format  - A type-dependent string used to provide additional options to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           the formatting operation.  Refer to the documentation of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           various individual format providers for per-type options.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// char    - The padding character.  Defaults to &#39; &#39; (space).  Only valid if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           &#96;loc&#96; is also specified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loc     - Where to print the formatted text within the field.  Only valid if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           &#96;width&#96; is also specified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           &#39;-&#39; : The field is left aligned within the available space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           &#39;=&#39; : The field is centered within the available space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           &#39;+&#39; : The field is right aligned within the available space (this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                 is the default).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// width   - The width of the field within which to print the formatted text.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           If this is less than the required length then the &#96;char&#96; and &#96;loc&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           fields are ignored, and the field is printed with no leading or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           trailing padding.  If this is greater than the required length,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           then the text is output according to the value of &#96;loc&#96;, and padded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           as appropriate on the left and/or right by &#96;char&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ===Special Characters===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The characters &#39;&#123;&#39; and &#39;&#125;&#39; are reserved and cannot appear anywhere within a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replacement sequence.  Outside of a replacement sequence, in order to print</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a literal &#39;&#123;&#39; it must be doubled as &quot;&#123;&#123;&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ===Parameter Indexing===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;index&#96; specifies the index of the parameter in the parameter pack to format</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into the output.  Note that it is possible to refer to the same parameter</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// index multiple times in a given format string.  This makes it possible to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// output the same value multiple times without passing it multiple times to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function. For example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   formatv(&quot;&#123;0&#125; &#123;1&#125; &#123;0&#125;&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;bb&quot;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// would yield the string &quot;abba&quot;.  This can be convenient when it is expensive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to compute the value of the parameter, and you would otherwise have had to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// save it to a temporary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ===Formatter Search===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For a given parameter of type T, the following steps are executed in order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// until a match is found:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   1 If the parameter is of class type, and inherits from format&#95;adapter,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      Then format() is invoked on it to produce the formatted output.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      implementation should write the formatted text into &#96;Stream&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   2 If there is a suitable template specialization of format&#95;provider&lt;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      for type T containing a method whose signature is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      void format(const T &amp;Obj, raw&#95;ostream &amp;Stream, StringRef Options)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      Then this method is invoked as described in Step 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   3 If an appropriate operator&lt;&lt; for raw&#95;ostream exists, it will be used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      For this to work, (raw&#95;ostream&amp; &lt;&lt; const T&amp;) must return raw&#95;ostream&amp;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If a match cannot be found through either of the above methods, a compiler</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// error is generated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ===Invalid Format String Handling===</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the case of a format string which does not match the grammar described</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// above, the output is undefined.  With asserts enabled, LLVM will trigger an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assertion.  Otherwise, it will try to do something reasonable, but in general</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the details of what that is are undefined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// formatv() with validation enable/disable controlled by the first argument.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight">... Ts&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Validate, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Fmt, Ts &amp;&amp;...Vals) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Params = std::make&#95;tuple(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/support/detail/#a7b7c745d9aa9e637371b87e5905f3fdc">support::detail::build&#95;format&#95;adapter</a>(std::forward&lt;Ts&gt;(Vals))...);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object">formatv&#95;object&lt;decltype(Params)&gt;</a>(Fmt, std::move(Params), Validate);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// formatv() with validation enabled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a27ca159b55c777fe871aeda55df19be1"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight">... Ts&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Fmt, Ts &amp;&amp;...Vals) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv</a>&lt;Ts...&gt;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, Fmt, std::forward&lt;Ts&gt;(Vals)...);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"></CodeLine>
